alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Grafton County through 430 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Groton, or 13 miles west of Plymouth, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Plymouth, Hanover, Canaan, Holderness, Groton, Woodstock, Piermont, Sandwich, Lyme, Benton, Dorchester, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Rumney, Campton, Warren, Thornton, Orford, and Waterville Valley. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 81 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New Hampshire.
